Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Here is my translation of your provided text: 
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, sons, since I have completed this book for you, which is the final work on the science of medicine, due to its completion and explanations, and also because it includes descriptions and declarations [of medical knowledge], in my view I must complete that treatise for you, which is a part of manual activity called surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because manual operation is totally neglected in our region and at this time, while there is great danger to the science [of medicine], and its traces are obscured; and what remains of it are only a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which have been altered by most and lead to error and hesitation, as understanding is closed off and force and art are elongated.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	It is clear to me that I must revive it through the ordering of this treatise according to the method of exposition, declaration, and abbreviation; and also by providing images of cautery tools and other instruments used in the operation as well as adding declarations and preparations, which are necessary causes.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The reason why a good artisan is rarely found these days is that the art of medicine is long and requires its practitioner to be well-versed in the science of anatomy first, which involves understanding the joints of the limbs and their forms, as well as their connections and separations; and knowledge of bones, nerves, and sinews, along with their numbers and exits; and of the pulsating veins and quiet ones, and the places where they emerge.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And so Hippocrates says that it has a great name but small action, and especially in the area of surgery.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already mentioned this in the introduction of this book; for whoever is not knowledgeable about what we have discussed regarding anatomy, they are not excused from falling into error which has caused the death of many people, as I myself have seen too many of those who are trained in this science but neglect their knowledge and experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	I saw a foolish and inexperienced doctor mistakenly make an incision on a scrofulous abscess located on the neck of a woman, and they cut some arteries in the neck causing great bleeding until the woman died while her maids were holding her.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	I saw another doctor who was about to extract a stone from the bladder of a man who suffered this condition; the stone was large so it tore part of his bladder when extracted causing him to die after three days.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	I have already been called upon to extract such stones and I saw that due to the size of the stone and the condition of the patient I knew they would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	Understood. Let's continue with the translation: 
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called upon to aid him; and so I prepared myself for removing the bonds, and thus achieved tranquility and some relief from his pain.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, if the corruption (gangrene) has already set in on the limb and cannot be halted, it will not cease spreading throughout the body until it becomes fatal for the patient.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	I also witnessed another doctor perforate a cancerous abscess that had been festering for several days while becoming increasingly virulent as its owner neglected it.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Which is due to the fact that as the cancerous growth has its origins in melancholic humours, it should not be treated with iron but with another member of the body from which the humour can be extracted.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, my child, it is necessary for you to design the operation in two parts; one part dedicated to healing and restoration of health, while another dedicated to the most perilous procedures.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	I have already outlined this in every chapter of the book where I discuss operations that are fraught with error and fear; it is necessary for you to ensure you keep these apart and do not mix them, lest the pages turn against each other and bring dishonour upon yourself.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And so, take up your arms with solicitude and protection from God, and bring ease and resilience to your ailments.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	Use the best path for your well-being and with God's grace, lead yourself towards healing and praiseworthy recovery. Leave behind those terrible ailments that are difficult to cure, and put aside your fears of what afflicts you so that doubt does not cloud your faith or diminish your name: for greater is what remains in your glory here on Earth and beyond to your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Julia has already dissected some of her instructions:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat severe illnesses, lest you be known as poor physicians.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The division of the book begins, first in the first part:
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter is an arrangement of the material within this book; it concerns feet, the instruments and tools of cauterization, and what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The translation of the provided text into English is as follows: 
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Divisio de la tersa partida.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter is about the restoration and treatment of dislocations, as well as curing twisting or similar issues; this chapter is organized from head to toe and describes the forms of instruments used.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Using a cautery with fire and sharp medical tools, we recall the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	This begins the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I want to tell you about the quality of the jugments regarding that cautery and its documents, and in which case it is prohibited to use a cautery.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, I say that the discourse on the quality of the judgments regarding cautery and its documents is long and prolix, subtle due to its scientific nature, and secret, hidden knowledge; many wise people have already spoken about it and disagreed, so I will suffice with a small part of their discourses, fearing lengthiness.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And so I say that cautery can be applied universally to all conditions that have matter or will have matter, with the exception of two conditions, which are immaterial.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the case of a dry and cold condition with matter, there is disagreement; some say that cautery is beneficial for such a condition, while others argue the opposite, that cautery is not suitable for illnesses caused by qualities and dryness because the nature of fire is hot and dry, which would be detrimental to healing a condition that is already cold and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And he says that whoever claims the opposite, that cauterization is beneficial for all chronic and dry diseases that affect men's bodies, because when you compare man's body and its fluids to the nature of fire, you find man's body cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say this based on the words of that person, as my own experiments have shown me.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not suitable for those who are inexperienced and have not practiced in the art of cauterization through extensive practice, understanding the diversity of human constitutions, the distribution of diseases within their bodies, as well as their causes, symptoms, and durations.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But for other constitutions, there should be no fear [of using this method], especially in cold and humid diseases since all doctors have agreed upon them and are not divided on the beneficial use of cauterization in such cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, my sons, that of the secret of healing through cauterization with fire and its goodness is attributed to cauterization with caustic medicines [substances], for fire is simple, whose action does not pass beyond the member being cauterized nor harms the adjacent one except slightly.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	Moreover, the action of burning medicine affects those body parts from which it keeps away, and its strong odor makes diseases difficult to cure come into sick limbs very quickly.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, due to its sublimity and the goodness of its substance, does nothing but superfluous things. And it is known to us through experience and a long history of studying art about the truth of causes; and that is why I am excused from lengthening my speech. If it were not because my book is not read in this remote place where you are hidden with fire and its operation within bodies, and its expulsion by which you expel illnesses, with demonstrative philosophical speeches, which would sharpen your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And you should know, my children, that they disagree about the time when it is appropriate to do cauterization and consider spring the best season for this practice.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cauterization is suitable at any time because the harm caused by delaying it due to seasonal changes can be compensated for with what is gained through cauterization. This is especially true when dealing with necessary pains and fistulas, which cannot wait without risking further damage; a minor evil today is preferable to a greater one later on.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	Here is the translation of the first line: 
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Moreover, superfluous cauterization [or burning] is performed due to the haste of the healer and the effectiveness of its operation and the greatness of his master.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that the illness may return at some point in time depending on the patient's constitution and the location of their ailment, as well as their overall health and the presence of excesses within their body, along with what has been consumed through food or similar causes; however, for illnesses where cauterization is administered like subtle joint pain with few excesses and humors, such as toothaches and similar, it is possible that the pain may not return after cauterization, but this is done in a minor way.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	The common saying is that cauterization is the last resort in medicine, and this is true from a legal perspective; it refers to how people perceive it, believing that it provides no real benefit or cure beyond medicine or any other method except for cauterization.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	The reason for this is the opposite; the intention behind referring to cauterization as the last resort in medicine is not incorrect. When we apply various methods of treatment for certain illnesses and those medicines fail to provide relief, it is then that one administers cauterization at the end, and it proves beneficial.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And here is what needs to be done: although cauterization is the last resort in medicine, not according to the intention of those who understand it, namely ordinary people and too many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cauterization with gold is better than iron, and they say this because of the equality of gold and the nobility of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	They said that the place of cauterization is not harmed by gold, but this is not absolutely true, for I have proven it and found that it only does so in some bodies without others, and cauterization with it is good and better than iron, as they say; however, when you perform cauterization with fire using gold, it's not up to you to declare (the quantity), because it ignites according to the amount you want due to the delicacy of gold, and because it prepares to receive heat; and if you place it over the flame, the gold melts due to the fire, and in case some sheets are present due to the work of the artisan.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this reason, cauterization with iron should be done more lightly and precisely to ensure the accuracy of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	I have organized this chapter on cauterization according to the different chapters and those of the head within the feet, so that later the inquirer can find what they want from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization affects moisture and coldness in the brain, which are two causes of frequent bleeding, known as 'corissa', from the head to the parts of the arms and ears that leak fluid, and also a lot of drowsiness, toothache, sore throat, and generally all illnesses caused by coldness, such as paralysis, gout, and apoplexy.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The process of this cauterization is as follows: First, command the patient to be emptied with laxative medicine by regulating their diet for three or four nights, depending on how strong the patient's health and age are and what they usually eat.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	Then command them to shave their head with a razor and make sure they lie down between two servants on an inclined board while placing their hands upon their feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	Then place the edge of your palm near his nose, between its nostrils.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	Meanwhile, as your finger of the middle place has reached there, mark that place with a tent and get the olive-oil cautery which is shaped like this:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that on the marked spot with force, so that it descends and gradually compresses his hand, and you turn him around.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then gently lift your hand and check the area; if you see that any part of the bone or skull is exposed to some degree, like the amount of an egg's width, raise your hand. If it doesn't return to the iron instrument (or another one nearby) as it cools down, take a look at what I've mentioned.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a small amount of salt, dissolve it on the wound, and leave it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then place a coagulated egg in butter on him, leaving it until the burn's scab is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the wound with four-ingredient ointment until it heals.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And it is said that when the Roman plague arrives, a better arm is obtained, as it provides more protection and support.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	Some of them say that the skull bone should be cauterized to make an opening in it, and they hold on to the iron until some part of the membrane covering the brain adheres to it.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And now remove this which is stuck to the bone, and it shall be treated.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others said that the cautery should be applied to the back part of the wound, pressing strongly onto the bone until it reaches deep inside and touches the bone itself. This is the small cauterization process:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	It is believed that from this place, the vapors of the head escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And if the wound remains open for a long time, it shall be treated once it has started to heal.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I have not seen these two types of cauterization performed often, only in a few cases due to fear; however, I believe that one's health should always come first when making such decisions. This is especially true as the head can become weakened by excessive discharges and solutions, just like what we've observed in other body parts, especially if the patient has an inherently weak constitution.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The first type of cauterization is safer and more beneficial, in my opinion, and I recommend using it for the patient's well-being.
Capitol segon.	Chapter Two.
Del cauteri del cap.	On the Cauterization of the Head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When a patient experiences chronic and long-lasting pain in the head, and this pain persists despite using various treatments such as bloodletting, leeches, purgatives, plasters, poultices, baths, hot compresses, and other similar remedies, especially if they have already been cauterized with a cautery iron that we described but it did not provide any benefit or improvement to their condition. In this case, consider whether the patient's head is of strong constitution in its nature; if it is not fragile and receives much cold, then cauterize it again with another type of cautery, slightly less intense than the previous one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Then cauterize that area on their head, right above the temples, using a split cautery iron.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Open the split and expose the bone to the extent we have described, then cauterize it with a cautery on the back of the head in an area called the 'vase' - which is where the cupping glasses are placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And be careful with your hand there, do not expose the bone, because the patient will experience intense pain that is different from any other head cauterization procedure.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And we will leave this cautery in place, because the cautery that is used to treat the temples and occipital areas of the head is a more delicate cautery than the one used for the top part of the head; this is its shape: [insert illustration or description]
Capitol ters.	Capitolo tre." (Chapter Three)
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the cauterization of non-ancient hemorrhoids.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When a severe headache occurs or pain spreads behind the eye, evacuate it with cleansing medicines and administer another treatment I have mentioned for various illnesses; if all this brings no relief, there are two ways of cauterization: either with a caustic medicinal substance, or with an iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	A caustic medicinal substance is made by taking a fig tree twig and stripping off its bark at both ends.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then make an incision at the site of pain in the temple with a lancet placed so that it is over the location where the twig was stripped, provided this location is concealed.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then press it with a compress to prevent any discharge and leave it for three hours; then remove the fig tree twig, take out the scabs, and let the place remain open for two or three days, then apply to it a poultice of barley gruel until the place is healed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat him with ointment until he is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish to prepare some caustic medicines, I have written about a few in the second treatise on caustic substances.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	The application of the cautery may be performed in this manner: ignite the cautery, which is shaped as such:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	It is called 'claw tacks', as its head resembles the shape of a nail with a slight curve, and there is a small prominence in its middle.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then place it on the painful area, hold your hand to prevent the bowstring from adhering (which is underneath), and turn the iron slowly with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount that adheres to the bowstring is such that half of it sticks, raise your hand to prevent the artery from adhering (which is underneath) so that there is no outflow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then soak cotton in salty water and place it on the area for three days. Afterwards, apply moistened cotton with ointment until they are healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you cauterize, do so at the extremity of the radial artery according to the cautery, and be careful not to incision the artery in this rather recent migration.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Four.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Regarding the cauterization of an old migration (of the body, I assume).
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat a migration with what we have discussed about the previous cure and in the divisions of illnesses, and it does not benefit from the cure (that is to say, the illness has progressed past the point where cauterization or fire would be effective), then you must ignite the knife-like cautery until it is white hot, as this signifies that the place of pain along the length of which is half a finger, or so; and once you have placed your hand over it once and held in incision towards the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be mindful of the continuity of the jaw, which is damaged due to chewing, and that the tendon should not adhere to it nor the nerve that caused this damage, and that there are no spasms.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the caution and care regarding the flow of blood from an artery that has been cut, as there is fear in cutting it, especially for one who does not know what they are doing or is inexperienced; and leaves the operation to them at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come back to the recollection of the regimen for the accidental bleeding from archery wounds, in its place within this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you encounter this illness and find that the patient's body can withstand it without this cautery method, apply the cautery to the middle of their head as we have previously described, and treat the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And when you administer the cautery that we have mentioned in the chapter on stretching archery wounds with two cautery irons, this method of cauterization is better and more effective.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5:
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When ear pain occurs due to rubbing and is treated with laxative remedies along with the other treatment mentioned in the previous section, but the pain persists without any relief, then apply the pointed cautery. Here's the form it should take:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then prick the ignition point and move it around the entire ear as if you were drawing a circle, or in a circular motion around each section of the ear where the pain is located.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Gently guide the cautery from the base of the ear upwards, taking care not to miss any spots as you go along.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	Once you have covered all the points with the cautery, take it away and then treat those areas until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	De cauterizacio de turtura.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Turtura la cual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	Here is my line-by-line translation of the provided text: 
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery on the opposite side of the affected area, for softening [of the skin] occurs only in the part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The way of performing the cauterization is that you cauterize it with a cautery on the right side of the earlobe, placing a small piece above the crown of the head, and another one on the temple, whose length should be according to the length of your pinky finger, and place your hand holding the cautery until the amount equivalent to half the thickness of the skin is burnt.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the shape of the cautery, which is specific to the surgical knife, whose form should be flat on top.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is more subtle to have one that is slightly thinner like this; it's necessary to cut off a little bit of the superfluous thickness.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the area with this which was previously cauterized until it is healed.

De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On the cauterization of ancient stroke.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When a stroke is long-standing and you have treated it with what we have mentioned earlier but the patient does not respond to your medication and has no fever, then cauterize that area with four cauterizations: on all corners of their head; with a cautery in the middle of the scalp as we have said; and with a cautery near the nape.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	The method of applying the cautery is done as previously described.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	He has already been cauterized over the stomach area, which is further down; now treat him with what you have at hand.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8:
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On cauterization of the skull performed with a flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Give to the patient in the beginning large cups of water and pills made with refined flour.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then shave the patient's entire head, and apply over their nape a plaster as described in the treatise on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And leave it for some time, for this is how one does cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this according to the method I have already mentioned.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And if this heals them, it is good; otherwise, make three cauterizations on the back of their head, descending from the upper part of the head towards the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	Place something as thick as your finger between each cauterization, and then treat the cautery with an appropriate agent.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	If the patient is able to tolerate it, apply cautery to their forehead; but if they have more severe symptoms, then cauterize above both temples.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Treat it properly until they heal, and make sure the olive-shaped cautery is done according to the form previously mentioned.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the cauterization of paralysis, and softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Cover the patient's head with hot irons and do as we have said; then shave their head, and cauterize it with a cautery on the forehead, another over each temple, another at the back of the head, and three more on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then treat that area once it is healed, and use an olive oil-based ointment for this.

De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Here is the line translated into English: 
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	Therefore, it is necessary to modify the patient's mind at the beginning with years and another cure which we have mentioned in the division when the illness is severe, and they can tolerate the application of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who cannot bear the medicines, then administer gargles and chewable remedies to modify their mind; do this for several days before with proper nourishment of food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then shave the patient's head and apply a cautery to the top of their head with the previous method; use another cautery on their occiput (back of the head) and cauterize both sides of their skull.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	If the patient is strong and can tolerate it, then apply the mentioned cauteries; do so in a gradual manner with soft pressure on the neck vertebrae and back vertebrae.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And use an olive-shaped cautery as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	However, if the patient is a child, then use a gentle, small cautery in this manner.
Capitol .xi.	It seems you are referring to a specific chapter or section of the medieval medical treatise with this title. Can I provide any further information about Chapter 11 or translate another portion of the text for you?
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	De cauterizacio de melencolia.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupt, damp humors and a weak constitution, then cauterize that area with the cauteries we mentioned earlier for treating paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is an excess that leads to this condition, and the patient's body is moist or humid, then give them a drink that purifies their brain, according to the method described previously in the division on this subject.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then shave the patient's head, and make a suitable bandage for them with material that has been previously soaked in warm water, and place this bandage on their head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And if the patient is sixty years old and has been suffering from this condition for some time.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then apply a liniment; it is best to use old sheep's wool for this purpose.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat it over the fire to warm it up moderately, which will provide relief when applied to them.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then place it on the top of their head within the circle, and leave it there until it cools down.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	Do this to the patient once a week, along with their other treatments until they are healed; or if you wish, cauterize that area by making small punctures according to its size, but be careful not to touch it with your hand while holding a cautery like this: this is a special type of cautery that moistens the brain evenly.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place that swollen elbow in barley water or goose grease.

De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Regarding the cauterization of water veins in the thigh." 
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have identified the onset of water in the heel through the signs I mentioned earlier, then start and give the patient something to drink that will change their head [mental state], and keep them away from all humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And have him soak in warm baths for some days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then command him to shave his head and cauterize it with a pointed instrument in the middle of the scalp; then cauterize two spots on either side of the temples if there is water discharge from both heels, or only one spot if there is discharge from just one heel.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cauterize all the veins and arteries that are beneath your scalp; let these cauterizations be done at a distance from one another, on a line parallel to where the temples would be.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	Beware of blood flow during cauterization; if you see the patient's blood flowing, stop it with whatever medicine is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	I will come with the knowledge of extracting arteries, removing them if necessary, and stopping blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized in the neck below the two bones with two newly made cauteries.

De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On the cauterization of old tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears of the eyes are old and persistent, flowing through the veins and arteries in a visible location on the head, and it is verified that there is an excess of phlegmatic humors, then cauterize that area with a cautery as described in the initial chapter about boiling water for the eyes. Use one cautery on the top of the head, two on the neck below temples, and another two on the neck beneath the bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you need to apply additional treatment, then cauterize that area at the end of the eyelid near the eyebrow with a small cautery.

De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization for foul odor from the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	Here is the translation of the provided text:

Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the softening cautery for the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened due to illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with this lunar cautery; and this is its shape:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And when you cauterize that area above both eyebrows a little with two cauteries in all directions, and they extend from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And its length is equal to each part of the eyebrow's quantity.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand on the cautery too hard; rather according to how much the upper eyelid is adhering.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.: When the eyelashes become divided and turned inward, treat it with a cautery on the eyelid to straighten them.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquells es segons dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.: When the eyelashes turn inwards and irritate the eye, the cautery treatment for this condition can be performed in two ways: either with an iron instrument or with caustic medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.: If you use a cautery with fire, instruct the patient to first clean their eyelashes like they would usually do when cleaning them, making sure they are long and moist. And if you need to apply medicine, gently close their eyes with a bandage so it is not harmed until the medicine has taken effect.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.: Once they are moist and ready, place the patient's head in your lap and mark their eyelid with a sign resembling the shape of a myrtle leaf, starting the mark near the eyelashes.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then apply a poultice made of barley broth or bran gruel on the wound.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Then ignite the cautery, which should have this shape.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Cauterize following the pattern you have drawn, slowly and in small spots, burning off the surface of the skin as if it were a myrtle leaf.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	A sign of the treatment's success is when you see the eyelid of the wound contract and its hair stand up above the puncture.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And so lift your hand and leave it be for three days, then apply a poultice with borders until the scab forms.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if the hair grows back for some reason and the eyelid becomes soft again, then do the cauterization once more as you did initially.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	If the hair is still on the eyelid, then cauterize it until it rises to its natural place and remains there without harming the wound.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place your finger on the medicine and gently press it without causing any pain until the patient feels a tingling sensation from the medicine, for this tingling is like fire within them.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	So when you perceive that he feels this burning sensation, then remove the medicine and wipe it with your little finger; once the tingling stops, remove the medicine again and wash the area with water. Then examine if the eyelid is still swollen like before, if washed properly there should be no contraction due to fire or incision, for in that case everything is well. If not, apply more of the medicine on the spot where you have not pressed it yet, without disgracing yourself so as not to ruin your operation and contract the wound.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then place a bandage over it so that the wound heals properly and prevent infection, then treat it with ointment or another medicine until it is completely healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you to diligently ensure during your operation that none of the medicine falls into the eye, and if after some days the eyelid becomes softened due to hair growing on the wound, then repeat your application of medicine in the same manner as before onto this softened part of the eyelid. Then bind them so they may heal.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra." 
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that the strength of men is diversified according to their size and smallness, and therefore it is made like this for you.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the way of recipe-making is not hidden from him who studies this art.

De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of a fistula that is in the tear duct of the eye." 
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula using the methods we have discussed in previous sections on illnesses and your treatment does not yield results, it is recommended that you cauterize the affected area as follows: instruct the patient to lay their head on your lap, with one of your ministers holding their head gently between their hands, ensuring they are comfortable and not agitated.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then place a poultice made of owl droppings or feather mucus on the wound.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then ignite the following type of cautery:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	It should be concave in shape, resembling a cane or an eagle's feather, with the cauterization end being crafted from it.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you are penetrating through to the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you wish for it to exit, do so in the manner of an arrow.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, that which is concave is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Then press on the open fistula, attempting to clean and dry it out.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then you must open it and remove its contents.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place the cautery, which should be well ignited, on him; you must keep your hand a little while near the cautery's handle close to his nostril so that you do not burn your hand or disturb the patient too much; then put it on the grey part of the nose and destroy it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And if at the beginning of your cauterization it does not penetrate into the bone, then do nothing; but if this is not the case, you must repeat the cautery once or twice, as needed; and leave it like that for three days; then place a piece of linen over it smeared with drying ointment until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if eleven days have passed by and it is not healed yet, then you must apply corrosive medicine to the patient until the bone is uncovered; and scrape it according to what you deem suitable in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another method of cauterizing a fistula which some old men said: open the place of the fistula and then put in it a very thin thread whose form resembles that; And put into it one ounce of molten lead; you must keep your hand with great precision, and do not disturb the patient so that the molten lead does not reach his nose; and cover the patient's nose with cotton wool or water soaked in vinegar, because the lead hardens the place of the fistula and heals it by a wonderful healing process.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have mentioned about cauterization and treatment, it is good. If not, then it is necessary to administer nasal drops and reduce the fistula by drawing it back into the nose, according to its proper place.

De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cauterization of the anal fissure." 
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those fractures with what we have discussed in the previous sections and your treatment does not bring improvement, then use a small pointed cautery like this one with the following shape:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let its cavity be according to the delicacy of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place that instrument carefully into those fractures until the cautery reaches the bottom of the fracture.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.

De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cauterization of fistulas in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When there is an abscess at the root of the uvula, or on the palate, or at the roots of the teeth and it breaks, becomes old, corrodes the bone, and a fistula forms, if your treatment does not bring improvement, you must cauterize according to the size that fits into the fistula. Then place the hot iron in the tract of the fistula, with your hand pushing until the hot iron reaches its bottom and back. And then treat it as we have said for healing.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	Under these circumstances, if the wound is separated and healed well, then it's fine; otherwise, it will be necessary to open up the area again and remove the corrupted bone as we shall explain in this chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cauterisation of teeth and softening of gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened due to moisture and teeth become painful, but treatment with medicine is ineffective, place the patient's head in your lap, then take the cautery tool shaped as described below, quickly insert the heated rod into it, and hold it near the tooth so that the patient feels the heat reach the root of their tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then lift your hand and repeat the process with the cautery tool several times as you see fit.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	After that, have the patient rinse their mouth with salt water and keep it for an hour; then wipe it dry, since the painful tooth has been soothed, the softened gums hardened, and corrupted moisture dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text into English: 
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is caused by coldness or when there is a worm in it, and you cannot treat it with medicine, then the cauterization process should be done in two ways: either with cow urine or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	For cauterization with cow urine, you should take fresh cow urine and pour it into an iron tube or vessel; then, take a cotton wick, dip it in the hot urine, and place it quickly on the painful tooth until it becomes cold.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	Repeat this process several times until the virtue or power of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	If you wish, dip the wool or cotton wick in the cow urine mentioned above and place it on the aching tooth; then put a red-hot iron on it so that the iron reaches the pulp cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, when performing cauterization with fire, pay attention to the cannula, whether it is made of horn or iron; there should be no obstruction in the patient's throat that prevents the sharpness and heat of the flame from reaching their mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then prepare the cautery in the desired shape and place it on the tooth, holding your hand over it until the cautery becomes cold. Perform this action several times if the pain returns or persists for a day or more.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is required that due to the pressure of that cautery, the patient fills their mouth with good vinegar and holds this for an hour then spits it out; and this is the way of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	Scorch with fire whichever extremity you see fit to do so.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the way of the cannula:
