De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	On the treatment of descending water from the wound." 
Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.	Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre un cayrat e lia le sieu huel sa, lu mot stringent.	Now make sure that you place the patient between your arms on a cushion and tie their hands firmly.
E aprop pausa prop de la palpebra del sieu huel la tua ma senestra, si le huel en le qual es l’aygua es le huel senestra; o am la tua ma dreyta, si le huel es le dextre.	Then place your left hand close to the eyelid of their left eye if there is water in that eye or your right hand if it's on the right.
E aprop am la tua ma dextra pren almagda, si le huel es senestre; o am la tua ma senestra, si le huel es de dreyt.	Then take the cotton with your right hand if it's for the left eye or your left hand if it's for the right.
E aprop pausa la extremitat de almagda prop de la corona per la grossesa del ray en le album del huel de part del mendre lacrimal, e aprop enpelleys almagda am vertut e revol la tua ma am aquel.	Then place the tip of the cotton near the edge of the eye for its thickness with album in it from the smaller lachrymal gland and then wipe the cotton with virtue and roll your hand to that.
E aprop penetre en le album del huel e sentas que almagda ja es pervenguda a causa vueda.	Then penetrate the water of the eye and feel that the cotton has already reached it due to your touch.
E cove que sia la masura del cami de almagda al preon la mesura del spazi le qual es de la pupilla entro a la fi de la negror, e es la corona del huel; quar tu veyras am aquel pupilla am la visio de l’huel per la clartat de la tunica cornea.	Make sure that the length of the cotton path to your thumb is equal to the distance between the pupil's edge and the black part's end, which is also the eye's border; you will see with it the pupil by looking through the clarity of the cornea.
E aprop pausa almagda entro al loc en le qual es l’aygua, e aprop tu la atira en jos una veguada aprop autra, e donc si la aygua descen tantost, lahoras vetz le malaute aquo sobre le qual huebre la sua vista tantost, e almagda en le sieu huel.	Then place the cotton inside where there is water and then pull it down once or twice; if you see that the water descends a little, then you will find the patient who has opened their eyes and the cotton in their eye.
E aprop repausa se un pauc; donc si la aygua es descenduda, lahoras tu depausa aquela autre veguada abantz que almagda ne sia getada.	And then rest a little bit; therefore, if the water has descended, you must remove that other one before a clot is formed.
E donc quan es sicada e no descen, lahoras tu extrat almagda am facilitat, e revol am aquel la tua ma pauc a pauc, e aprop dissolveys en l’aygua un petit de sal clara de gemma e am aquela lava le huel dedintz; e aprop pausa fora le huel coto o stopa o lana infusa en oli rozat e album de huou e ligua am aquo le huel sa.	And when it is dry and does not descend, you extract the clot with ease, turn it over with your hand little by little, then dissolve a little clear gem salt in water and wash the wound from within; finally, place outside of the wound a piece of cotton or wool infused in rose oil and egg white, and tie it up with this.
Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	We and those who are of our time place on it, when it is broken up, egg white.
E si no obezeys a tu almagda al intrament de l’huel per la sua duricia — quar es alcu dels homes del qual le huel es dur mot —, lahoras cove que prenguas le spatum le qual es nompnat alberid del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if you do not obey, put the clot inside the wound due to its hardness - for it is one of those men whose wounds are very hard - then take the spatula called 'alberid', which has this shape:" (likely followed by a description or illustration)
E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	And so perforate with that the joint, but do not finish pulling out your hand, and it is nothing other than to create an outlet for pus.
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	And then introduce the clot as we have said.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	And consider the nature of this [illness] so that its true nature is cleansed, and do not damage his head on the right or left side at all.
E sia le liament segon la sua disposicio entro al tertz dia.	And let the ligaments be bound according to their arrangement within three days.
E aprop deslia aquel en aquela maysso tenebrosa e exproha la freol vista, e fay li vezer alcunas causas, e aprop retorna le liament entro al dia .vii.	Then untie him from that dark place and expose his pale sight; make him see certain causes, and then rebind the ligament within seven days.
E no cove que fassas aquo en la hora de las curacios o tantost aprop la infusio.	And you should not do this during the hour of treatment or immediately after the infusion.
Habantz cove que tu alienes aquo per so quar la aygua puega leugierament per gran e vehement de reguardament.	Later, make sure you remove this [obstacle] for which water flows more lightly through the large and vehement of the intestines.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que deslias le huel denant le vii dia, e rectifica aquel am aquo que ceda apostema.	But if an acute abscess occurs, then you must untie the cord before the seventh day and treat that which caused the abscess.
Lahoras tu absol la vista de lu e pausa sobre la cara de lu oral per le qual sia regit le vezement de lu dejos lu per alcus dias, lu existent en la mayszo tenebrosa.	Then you restore his sight and place a cloth over his face; this is how he will be treated for some days, him being in the darkest of places.
E aprop sia gitat de aquela mayzo gradantment e conversa8 en las suas causas.	Then he is brought out of that dark place, gradually growing accustomed to it, and begins conversing about his causes [of pain].
E sapias que in alchatea no es excusat le discipol de visio alcunas veguadas, e lahoras tu sias ardit sobre la operacio.	And remember that as an apprentice of alchemy, you are not allowed to have any kind of visual impairment or handicap when performing operations.
E ja es pervengut a nos de alcu de aquels les quals so al Artach , e alcu disse que fayt foc en al Ayrac magdaam perforat am le qual es succada la aygua.	We have encountered some of those people who practice the art of divination, and one person claimed that they can create fire in a jar full of water.
Mays empero yeu non e vist degu en la nostra terra le qual haia perfeyt aquo, ni e aquo legit en alcu dels libres dels antics; e es possible que aquo sia novel.	However, I have never witnessed anyone in our land accomplish such a feat, and it is not documented in the ancient books either; thus, this claim might be a recent invention.
E aquestas so las formas de las specias de magdaan per que sia sobre aquelas aquel le qual ignora aquelas:	These are the different ways of practicing magic to achieve various effects, and it is meant for those who wish to learn such abilities.
E sian faytas de eram o de ferr propriament, e sian las extramitatz de lor am aquesta subtilitat triangulada, la extremitat aguda ayssi cum aquela es la forma.	Whether they are made of glass or iron, their ends should be pointed with this subtle triangle shape; the pointy end is what gives them form.
Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter 24.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	On the treatment of nasal injuries or wounds.
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When different types of flesh grow inside the nose due to some cause similar to a scorpion's stinger or a polyp-like growth, this condition is called polyposis, which takes its name from the resemblance it has with such sea creatures.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And his flesh is cancerous, ulcerated, and of a dark color; while that which is not of a dark color is called healthy flesh.
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	So in the case of this healthy flesh that is not fraudulent or cancerous, it is necessary to make the patient lie down between your two hands and expose him to the sunlight, then open his nose and prick his diseased flesh with a needle.
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	Then extract that which has been separated outside and divide what you have understood of this with a thin sharp spatula from one part to another until you know that all the flesh has been removed; for if any cause of it remains from which separation is possible, then take that away with one of the fine instruments with ease while some cause remains.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	But if it should happen that blood flows from it or an evil abscess occurs, then you apply to him what is necessary; but in the case of one of these evil abscesses, then cover and cauterize this part until blood stops flowing and all cavities have been cleaned.
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	Then having made the incision in the nose, pour into it vinegar or wine mixed with water.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	But if the nose is opened and moisture proceeds from it to the palate, then you know that he is healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	It seems like this text describes medical procedures and treatments for various ailments. Here is the translation of the first sentence: 
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore, when you need to insert the gallbladder of an animal with some fat into the patient's nose, use as many almonds as necessary and place them between each nut in the amount of one finger or less. Trick the patient and insert one end of the gallbladder into their nose using a rod or any other available tool.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And after doing this, let the patient inhale the smell of it through their nostrils and sniff it over their throat, because young children in school often do similar actions without thinking much about what they are doing.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	Then secure both ends of the gallbladder, one end sticking out of the nose and the other remaining inside the nose. Also, put meat locks on the nuts that are part of the gallbladder until you feel that the meat is firmly attached to them.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	After that, remove the gallbladder and place in the nose a sponge soaked in blood-letting liquid for three days or more until the ointment corrodes all the remains of the meat.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	Finally, at the end of this treatment, put in their nose a lead tube for several days until they are healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if you want to avoid complications in the cure that follows, use this.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	This is the shape of the purging instrument which is used to distil oils and medicines into the nostrils:
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	Make it out of silver or brass, resembling a small open lamp with a similar bowl and nozzle.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you wish, make an enclosed nozzle like a tube, and the nozzle of the purging instrument be flat and open; there should be a handle at its back which you can hold when heating oil or water with juices or extractable substances.
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	These purgatives are useful: take beaver fat, white hellebore root, ginger, saffron powder, long pepper, black hellebore, and a drachm of the spice spikenard, make it into 6 ounces with beet juice and cabbage juice, make them into pills, soak one pill in warm water, then put it up the patient's nose while they lie on their back.
Capitol .xxv.	It seems that you provided me with a chapter title. Can you provide some context or text for me to translate?
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	The worms are born in the extremities of the nose.
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Small, unseen worms are born in the extremities of the nose, and it is notable that their growth is faster on certain days when the care given to them is inadequate.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And for this reason, you should insert something at the beginning of its appearance, and eradicate it completely.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	Then place on that spot either a cautery or a caustic medicine, which will be in the place of it.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if its excision is delayed and it becomes larger, hardened, dark in color, and less sensitive, then do not touch it with iron because it is a cranial abscess; for those unseen worms that you introduce into this abscess will, due to their great malignancy, spread over the person who has it.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the abscess is of a light color and not dark, and it seems that its excision is possible in all of it, then evacuate the patient and excise it without fear, and treat the place with something that dries and constricts until it is healed.

De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	When it comes to stitching up the nose, lips, or ear after injury or similar incidents." 
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquella operacio sino en alcus homes: 
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, whenever any of these cases arise, you must first determine if the patient's blood is still fresh and whether it can be treated with stitching. Then close the wound with stitches and ensure proper healing.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the edges of the wound are already separated and each is healed, then you should carefully excise any part of the surrounding tissue until you reach a healthy, blood-free area.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then close the two edges of the wound with sutures and secure them tightly. Over the stitches, apply a mixture of dragon's blood powder and powdered cinnabar (red mercuric sulfide). Place a piece of diaphanicon plaster or any other consolidating plaster on top and leave it bandaged for two to three days. Afterward, remove the bandage, change the plaster, and continue treating with ointment until the wound is healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	The method of stitching can be either by joining the edges of the wound directly or using needles as we previously described for abdominal sutures. You can also sew the wound closed with thread (or "wool," as it was often called) in the manner you are already familiar with.

De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	Great care must be taken with the tightly bound gum that the Ancients called albulus; you should then suspend it by a thread or hold it between tweezers and extract its root completely, and let the saliva run out or the blood drain away.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	Then place on the area a powder made from sage that has been chopped into three parts, or other styptic or escharotic powders.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that flesh grows back, then excise it again and cauterise the area, for in this way the cautery will not return.

De razo de dentz am ferr.	Regarding the treatment of teeth with an iron instrument.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When the surfaces of loose teeth or those with gaps, and those between the gums become rough, coarse, some darkened and others turning yellow or green due to this corruption reaching the gum, then the teeth become weak. 
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	And so it is necessary that you hold the patient between your two hands and place their head in your lap, and scrape off from the teeth those rough spots which are similar to sand grains since there remains no other cause for them; this produces the darkening, yellowing, and other changes where they have been discoloured.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth often require various treatments and are of many shapes, depending on how they have been prepared for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And because the first razor with which you remove the tooth from its socket is different from another razor used to scrape between the teeth in other shapes and forms; these types of razors should be prepared, as you will see shortly:
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	On the extraction of teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	When you cure a tooth from its pain with all your might and proceed to extract it entirely, there is no reason for the loss of it when extracted, as its substance becomes sublime during this process and makes its extraction unnecessary.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	But know that when the patient is forced to have a tooth extracted, you must be firmly certain which tooth is painful, because many times pain deceives the patient and causes them to believe it is in a healthy tooth; thus you extract the wrong one and the pain does not cease as the diseased and painful tooth remains, for we have already seen this happen during jaw operations.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	Here is the translation of your provided medieval medical treatise: 
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And so if it is not forgotten, then take one of those instruments and place it below him on all sides with ease, applying force to remove him as was done initially.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is shaken or decayed, you should wrap it with cloth and bind it tightly with a thin silk thread at its base so that it does not break when you grasp it with forceps.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And make sure you carefully scrape all around the gum line and be very careful with your strength so as not to tear it and leave a part of it there, for this ailment is often worse than the initial pain.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	Take care not to do what some ignorant barbers do in their carelessness and audacity during tooth extraction without administering the things we have recommended; for many times they cause great illnesses upon men which are more difficult to treat, and the roots of the teeth remaining inside, whether partially or completely extracted with bone from the jaw as many times we have witnessed.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And afterward, let the mouth be washed with wine vinegar or sour wine mixed with salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	Here is my translation of the text: 
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And so it is that when a large implement enters [the body] and the intestines are not bent, they become short extremities.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And if they are made of India iron, shaped into straight extremities, and at the ends of these there are teeth that interlock with each other and grip strongly due to their tight constriction, and sometimes the ends of these have the shape of a bird's beak called a stork's beak, which is sharp, and has a strong constriction.
Capitol .xxxi.	This indicates that this section or chapter is number 31 in the treatise.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	On the eradication of teeth and extraction of bones from fractured jaws.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you must eradicate a tooth that is fractured for any reason, it is necessary that you place a poultice over the area with warm water for one or two days until the area softens; then insert your fingers or tongs with ends shaped like the beak of a bird called a stork or crania, which has the form of forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	Their ends should be made like a rasp or file.

E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so that no sia trinquat."

Otherwise, help yourself with these other instruments, which are as follows: The first instrument has a triangular shape with some thickness at its end.
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The second instrument should have a more delicate, triangular-shaped tip.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And you have already been aided by this instrument, having two levers, which have the following shape...
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	...and other instruments that will be used to scrape the teeth; when this is done with this instrument, which resembles an inch-wide grain, and its shape is thus.
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	Its triangular tip should be rounded or blunt, with some thickness, and not too sharp to avoid breakage.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And you should know that the instruments for broken teeth are similar to those already mentioned.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	A clever and subtle artisan in this art will also understand what the operation means for himself according to the diverse illnesses; since there are many diseases for which the ancients did not prescribe nor provide a specific instrument due to their various natures.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	Here is the translation of the provided text:

E sia en lu alguna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.

Capitol .xxxii.	Capitolo 32.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	The treatment of teeth is more prominent than other treatments. 
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When the teeth are prominent and not according to their natural shape for those whose appearance is deformed, especially when it happens in women, and more so in venerable old ladies, therefore you must consider this: if one tooth is very close to another tooth, and there is no possibility of removing or smoothing it out, then extract that tooth; but if it is not connected to any other tooth, then use this instrument to incise it, which is similar to a pig's molar and made of extremely sharp Indian iron.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And let your incision be such that you incise the tooth in too many days due to its hardness and that none of the other teeth are affected.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is an exposed prominent tooth that needs to be filed down, then use this file made of Indian iron shaped like this [insert shape here].
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	It is entirely made of Indian iron and very sharp; it has many small points like a file used for making needles, with which the tooth can be filed down gradually over several days without affecting or chipping any other teeth.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	Then lubricate it with oil in the end, and wash it with some sharp razors.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	On the restoration of broken teeth with gold or silver wire.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When it happens that the teeth are damaged due to concussion and dislodgement by impact or fall, and the patient cannot chew what they eat, and you have treated them with astringent medicines but your treatment has been unsuccessful, then know that there is no harm in using gold wire rather than silver to bind them since silver turns green and will need to be replaced after some days, while gold does not change color over time.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And let the wire be of such fineness and thickness according to the space that can fit between the teeth; the shape of the repair is as follows: take the wire and make it twice as long as the gap between two healthy teeth, then bend its ends with a twist so they reach the healthy tooth on either side of the damaged one(s).
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	Then repeat the weaving process to the starting point, and strengthen your grip with ease and skill so as not to damage anything.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And let your hold on the wire be such that you do not pull out the roots of these teeth.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And then leave it like that tightly wrapped in linen.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it is unbound or broken, strengthen it with another one in such a manner at all times.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	This is the shape of the teeth and the structure of two healthy teeth and two bad ones, bound like this:" (followed by an illustration).
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when it happens that a tooth or two are repositioned back into their sockets and have regrown as we have described, but they still remain bad.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	Do not do this unless you are skilled artisans and wise men.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And in some cases, a suitable substitute can be found in the bones of cows, and it is shaped like a tooth, placed into the space where the missing tooth should be, then tightened as we have said, remaining and serving its purpose for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	It seems this is simply indicating that the following text is Chapter 34 of this treatise or book.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	On the binding of the tongue, which results in speech impediment." (This appears to be the title or heading for Chapter 34.)
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation on him is to open his mouth, his head being placed in yours; and lift up his tongue, then cut that nerve-filled ligament according to its width so as to free the tongue from its restraint.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	However, if there is any hardness or obstruction due to the solidification of pus, then you must pour in oil and cut through it according to its width until you have divided the ligament and released the obstruction.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And be careful not to make a fissure in the front part of the flesh, lest you cut through there and cause an artery or vein to flow with blood.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	Then let the remnants of the incision be washed with warm water or vinegar water or cold water; and place a linen cloth under the tongue; it is necessary for the patient to have the cloth underneath their tongue each night so that pus does not accumulate again.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	But if there is a flow of blood, place powdered vitriol on the site; and if the blood continues to come, then cauterize the area with an appropriate pointed cautery.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	Then treat him with other remedies until he is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Certainly, let me try to translate this medieval medical treatise for you. 
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	For extracting a ranula, place it below the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Some minor accidents occurring under the tongue, such as small abscesses resembling walnuts, hinder the tongue's natural movement and slightly enlarge within the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And for this operation on them, you open the patient's mouth towards the sun and examine the abscess.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see it is of dark or black color, hard, and the patient does not feel any pain when pressed, then do not touch that one.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	If it is inclined towards whiteness and has some moisture, then put your thumb on it and cut it with a fine spatula; divide it into parts and if blood comes out during the operation, apply powdered brimstone to stop the bleeding.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then return to your work until it is completed with its proper treatment; after which it should be washed with sour wine and salt; afterward, treat it with another water-based cure until it is healed.

De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	For the extraction of an abscess from both ears and the one that is in the throat, as well as other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When an abscess occurs in the throat, these are glands that have gathered pus, which burst outwards and are called two ears. When you treat them with what we have mentioned in the division [section] and it does not heal, then consider if the abscess is hard, of a dark color, and has little feeling. In such case, do not touch it with iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of a red color and the root [base] is thick, then do not touch it with iron due to the flow of blood; instead let it mature on its own, and then either you will cut it or it will break by itself.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of a white color, soft, and its base is delicate, then it must be scraped.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And before the operation is performed on it, one must consider whether the abscess has already reached its full rest or if it has diminished in any way. Then expose the patient to the sun, with their head facing east and let them open their mouth while the servant holds their tongue using a noble instrument of this shape: [unclear, possibly describing an illustration]
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it should be made of silver or brass, and be fine like a chisel.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	So when you press it with your tongue and the abscess is shown to you, catch it with your incision, then take tweezers and place them in the wound, pulling it outwards as much as possible.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Also remove any parts of the membranes and then make an incision with this tool, which has the following shape:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	It is assembled like forceps, but its ends are curved so that the orifice of each one faces the other, and it is very sharp, made entirely of iron.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	If this tool is not available to you, then make an incision with this spatula, which has the following shape: It should be sharp on one side and blunt on the other.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And once you have made an incision in one place, make the other incision following this same method, and then wash the patient's wound with warm water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a flow of blood, wash it with water decocted from the bark of pomegranates or myrtle leaves and similar astringent substances until the bleeding stops, then treat it until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the abscess had grown so much that it produced two legs within itself which came out through two openings.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Therefore, I treated it surgically by making an incision and placing one of the legs into its opening, then I drew out that leg, removing a large portion from it, after which I made an incision at the place where the other leg was connected to the abscess. Then I forced the mouth open, compressed his tongue, and finally placed the opening over the abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And I cut away a large part of it [the patient's flesh], leaving only a little bit of blood flowing.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Then the woman's wound completely healed, and she began to drink water and eat food immediately. I continued to make incisions in that abscess many times over a long period of time until an abscess formed again at the same spot where it was prolonged.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Then I applied medicine and cauterized the wound with hot iron rods until it healed entirely, after which I left her to walk freely without knowing what God had done to that poor woman.
