De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada." 
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When there is an accumulation of catarrh on the uvula, and it is inflamed and elongated, then it is called a "perpendicular." If it occurs at the lower part [of the throat] and is thicker and rounder in shape, it is referred to as a "bubo" (or bubonic swelling).
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	If after employing the methods we've outlined in this section to treat the condition and you don't see an improvement, be aware that sometimes when an abscess is already healed and has become thin-skinned, it may appear as if a round mass is attached to it; but if it's elongated, filled with bloody or dark-colored fluid, and doesn't hurt much when touched, then you should avoid incising it because there is a risk of harming the patient.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	When you notice the abscess according to what I've described before regarding its whiteness and length, make sure that the patient's illness is alleviated first by pressing their tongue with a tool designed for this purpose; then place one of your hands under the patient's neck, pull down on the lump while cutting it open using either a two-edged instrument or a sawing motion.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	Be careful not to incise the abscess unless it has reached its natural limit; otherwise, if you cut too deeply, you may cause speech impairment.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And then for the incision, use what we have previously discussed regarding double incisions, and ensure that it is properly healed.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	If the patient is afraid of undergoing surgery, you must employ some trickery during cauterization to ease their fear. The method for using the cautery on them should be as follows: place the head of the patient on your lap, then press down on their tongue with the instrument we previously mentioned and fill it with water (as described in the chapter on cauterization). Create a living fire within this water and ensure that it is neither too thick nor too thin. Fill the concave shape of the aforementioned instrument with this liquid.
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	The end of the concave cavity where you place the medicine should resemble the shape of a spoon's bowl and be placed on the patient's tongue. The instrument with the medicine should then be positioned over their mouth, so that they can drool or expel saliva from their mouth due to the intrinsic nature of the medicine itself. This will prevent any harmful substances from descending into their throat and causing further illness.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	Then place your hand on the medicine and squeeze it onto the uvula for a duration of about two hours, until you see that it has become blackened and softened due to the corrosive nature of this medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	Here is my line-by-line translation of the provided text: 
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	This type of treatment is safer than incision surgery and less terrifying for patients.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Some diseases are treated with the tonsils using something more subtle than cautery and incision. It is cured by sub-fumigation in this manner: Take alkanet, hyssop, rue, wormwood, Arabic styrax, chamomile, broom, and similar herbs; grind all these roots or some of them together in a mortar, submerge them in vinegar, let it boil, then seal the pot with proper wax; there should be an aperture at the centre of the pot where you place an instrument made from silver or other metal like this.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And insert the extremity into the patient's mouth so that the vapour reaches the tonsil on which it is obscured.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	Then repeat this treatment on the diseased spots once they have dried; be careful not to perform this cure at the onset of abscess formation as it would make the abscess worse and it is better to leave them alone than to treat with this method.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if you do not have this instrument at your disposal, take a reed and attach to its extremity a cock's spur so that the patient's mouth is covered as the cock's spur prevents steam from escaping the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this treatment is good for recovery.
Capitol .xxxviii.	This appears to be the chapter number, specifically "Chapter 38". Is there any specific text from this chapter that you would like me to translate or provide an interpretation for?
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On the extraction of thorns, substances adhering to the throat, and other related causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Obscured spots adhering to the throat, fish bones, or any other cause." 
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And now take an eel and extract its bile, tied up in a cloth, or take a leek and immediately put it in and immediately take it out.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if you haven't forgotten those causes we mentioned earlier, then use a leaden instrument in this shape:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And even if it is slightly thicker than a reed, at its end there should be a concavity which you can easily insert into their throat.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	Raise the top of it upwards and be careful not to touch their windpipe bone, for fear that you pierce the bone or spine with what the doctor has in his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But if the patient knows what is being inserted and pushes it down, out of their knowledge of where the pain is located, then pull your hand with the instrument back up according to how much you had prepared beforehand so as not to forget.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On the extraction of bloodsucking worms attached to the throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When you treat the patient with medicinal leeches as we have previously discussed in the section on treatment with medications and not manual manipulation, then look at their throat in the sun, since you must compress their tongue using an instrument that we have recommended to you.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore if you want to remove the leech, extract it gently with delicate movements or tools.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible for you to extract the leech with your hands, then take a concave cannula and insert it into the patient's throat; place a lit iron rod in the cannula's concavity; do this several times until the leech dies and detaches from the throat. Keep the patient away from water throughout the day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	Then take a jar filled with fresh water and place it near their mouth, so that you can wash the patient's mouth with this water; ensure they do not drink from said jar in any circumstance! Remove the water using your hand as soon as the leech detects it—for these creatures immediately fall off upon sensing water.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if you do not forget what we have recommended, then fumigate the patient with incense or asafetida using an instrument that we mentioned earlier when discussing throat fumigation.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, so that he falls asleep.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	Another way to perform the operation using fumigation is as follows: take a bowl with burning coals and cover it with a cloth that has an opening in the middle, into which you insert the end of the instrument; then place the patient over this fumigation; have them put their mouth on the end of the tube and seal their mouth so that the fumigation does not escape until you know that the fumigation has reached the blood vessel, for at that moment the blood vessel will fall asleep.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if he does not fall asleep, then you must repeat the fumigation many times and prevent the patient from drinking; have them eat salty foods and others, and do not drink water; it is necessary that this treatment be followed until the end.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	This is the shape of the instrument used to extract blood from the throat when it is visible; it resembles forceps in some ways, but with some curvature.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	Which is placed in the throat and its end resembles the beak of a stork that has been sharpened with a file, for when it grasps any object, it does not let go.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	Which is the summary of the sermon regarding the appreciation of apostemes (abscesses) and their incision.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Apostemes (abscesses) are specific spots with various appearances depending on the stage they are at; each one is described in detail in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are different in their treatment and incision due to two main reasons: the first is related to the type of aposteme itself, and the second depends on the amount of humidity they have.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	The second way is determined by the location where the aposteme occurs in the body, as an abscess on the head is different from one found on the buttocks or from the one occurring at a joint. Each type of aposteme requires specific treatment and intervention.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	Some types of abscesses should not be incised but rather allowed to mature until the pus drains naturally or be filled with medicine (ointment).
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	There are other abscesses that need to be pierced when they are hard and have not yet drained or softened, like the ones located close to a joint, as if you leave an abscess untreated next to a joint for too long it can cause the ligaments or nerves of said joint to get infected and become compromised. This leads to complications in movement by causing contractions in that limb. Another type of aposteme is one found on main limbs, which will damage the main limb itself if left untreated for too long before draining them; then you have the abscesses located next to or around the buttocks which should be drained when they are not yet fully developed (soft), and never pierced when hard because of the risk that this presents in damaging muscles and creating a fistula, or a cutaneous extension from said aposteme. Lastly, it is important to note that you should also not drain abscesses with poor digestion as this can lead to more complications and cause new apostemes.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	Here is the translation of your first source sentence: 
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And when you know that the abscess has descended into the place below the swelling, and when the pus is coming from the healing of the prominent part.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	Whether the abscess breaks through the surface of the flesh or the body, if they are in parts of the hands or feet, and on the spots where sinews have been cut, or ligaments; and finally, in all places similar to those in which there is no reflection (for in those that do reflect light, use perforation according to that member). 
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the abscess is in fleshy parts, it is better to postpone its perforation until digestion has been confirmed according to what we have said; for if you should perforate that part too soon, the course of the poor man's disease will be prolonged and a great deal of filth may enter it, and very likely the lips or edges of the abscess become hardened and its depth.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some abscesses are perforated according to the thickness of the flesh or body when necessity requires it, or in proportion to that member which is affected.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And take care to make a small incision in the case of small abscesses, and for large ones, a larger one or several cuts according to the size.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And from them are administered the round section and the lunar section, and those similar to it.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	If the one who has no such condition as superficial leopard's sores, you should make a shallow or flat incision only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the sore has gathered a lot of healthy matter, cut into it and do not hesitate to remove all that is bad at that time; first take out part of it, then apply a small piece of cotton wool to the sore the next day, then extract a larger portion, and repeat this several times until it is healed.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is a green-coloured young man, or a woman in labour, or a small child, or an old and decrepit person, as their vital spirit often escapes with the flow of healthy matter, and most likely the patient will die; you should operate on them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Pay great attention to this chapter, and when you make your incision into these sores, clean the wounds thoroughly and consider whether the sore is small or a flat section; in such cases administer either of the old medicines; but if the sore is large and there are many fissures from the incision, then you should fill each crack with an ointment until they are all closed up.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the flow of blood persists, then you must administer treatment and cure with powders that I have recommended in various parts of this book as well as in its division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is winter and the location of the abscess is in an area with many nerves, then you must apply powders soaked in warm wine and oil onto these places.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is summer and the areas are fleshy, then you must place powders moistened with water and oil or with wine and oil on them until the third day, as we have mentioned before, and afterwards you must open the abscess and clean it, applying to its cure whatever may be appropriate for healing.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary for understanding the healing of abscesses generally, but according to the way of distinguishing each type of abscess I have already spoken about how it should be cured in separate chapters.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	On the opening of abscesses which come on the nape of the neck.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the back of the head, there are small abscesses and various types of knots which contain membranes that form them; and their varieties have different shapes.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And they have points on them, and from these emerge humidity resembling lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And from them is the humidity that resembles dust, similar to it; and there are also those that are stony and hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the extraction of all these abscesses, there is no fear, for you must not hesitate to extract them.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	The operation for the extraction of these abscesses is that you use an instrument shaped like this, which is called an entromes, ensure it has what it needs inside.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what is contained within it is humidity, then cut that part with a shallow incision following this pattern:" (At this point, the text likely describes an illustration or diagram of the incision pattern.)
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	Start the incision at point B and follow the line to point G. Once the humidity is evacuated, you must excise that skin which contains this humidity, leaving behind no cause whatsoever, for any remaining trace will return if not completely removed.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	Here is the translation of the given text: 
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	Certainly! Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if there is an abscess with fatty nodules, then you should cut it open like this:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	Make a cross-shaped incision, and grab hold of the two lips of the incision with your fingers, tearing it apart so that everything is separated, and exert your strength in pulling out the membrane which contains the abscess.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if it opposes your efforts, then do what I first told you.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	Similarly, treat an abscess that has already hardened with the same incision and healing process we've described earlier; an incision over a hardened abscess is lighter because it contains little blood and moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes there are certain abscesses that appear on the head of some men which do not contain any moisture; this is because I once cut open an abscess on the head of an old woman and found within it a hard, rough, white stone-like substance that could not be broken apart, such that if anyone were to have struck it, it would have caused pain.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other abscesses on the head this phenomenon does not occur, such as abscesses that appear on children's heads or at the roots of their ears; in all these cases the incision should be made superficially.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And make an incision on those from the lower part of their body downward in order to relieve the pain at the lowest parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	Then treat those with what is appropriate for their treatment.
Capitol .xlii.	It seems that the provided text includes part of a medical manuscript, possibly describing various treatments or procedures for different ailments. 
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Many times these abscesses occur on the neck, armpits, and shoulders; sometimes they appear in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that appear on the neck are usually formed by an accumulation of matter between them, and any swelling in their own specific area is called scrofula; this is similar to swellings or abscesses on the head, as we have described before.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	There are different types of these scrofula: some are hard and stony, others contain moist matter, and there are malignant ones that do not respond to treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	When you examine the scrofula and find it is in good condition for treatment, meaning its appearance matches that of flesh with a healthy complexion, and it is not severe or attached to any nerves, veins, or arteries, and is not deep-rooted, then you should make an incision on top of it slightly above the body's midline towards the midline between the two breasts. Separate the edges of the wound by one or more fingers as required, just like we described for abscesses in the head, and carefully remove the scrofula bit by bit.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is important to exercise caution so as not to cut into a vein or nerve.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	If the space between the patient's legs is not wide enough and you cannot comfortably place your hand for incision, or if it disturbs the patient, and you cut into something that should not be cut; for instance, if you were to sever a vein or artery and thus hinder your operation, then apply powdered sulfuric acid or other powders that staunch blood flow, press upon the wound, and leave in place anything that supports the sharpness of the abscess until the wound softens and begins to become purulent.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When blood is severed.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Therefore, return to your operation before it is completed.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	Then investigate with your finger whether any small sores are caused by other minor scrofula outbreaks; cut into those and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is in the root of a large scrofula outbreak, be careful not to cut into that scrofula with its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Make sure to lift that with a strong bent needle, and leave it in place until it falls out by itself without harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then fill the wound with old cotton that you have already dipped in Egyptian ointment, and treat it accordingly.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you incise the entire scrofula, then make sure to align the two lips of the wound and sew it shut as soon as possible so that there is no excess.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you notice that there is still excess due to the size of the scrofula, it is necessary to understand that you must incise its root, extract it, and then apply the suture as mentioned above.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	For those scrofulas that contain moisture, pierce them with a shallow puncture at the point where it appears to you as the place of its maturation, and make a puncture like the one we described that drains puss from below.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	Then apply the puncture, cover it with ointment and similar substances to those, so that they may consume whatever is left of the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then when you see the wound cleansed, treat it with an ointment made of generative flesh until it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43: 
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of the incision of the pyogenic abscess within the throat.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients called this procedure an *epilhot*, but I have not seen anyone in our land perform it.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And here is the inscription of their speech:
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	As this extraction of the *epilhot* is dangerous for men with heart disease and because all of the patient's veins are here, it must be done carefully.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	However, in cases where there are pus-filled abscesses on the mouth or throat or behind the ears and the disease is not confined to the skin's surface, it is necessary to use an *epilhot* incision to avoid the loss that would be caused by piercing.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we wish to do this, we must incise the *epilhot* below three circles of the *epilhot*'s circles, or four times with a small section for its width in that which is between two circles by quantity; let the incision be on bone, not cartilage, and this place is suitable for incision because it is devoid of flesh and the patient's blood vessels are far away.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then cut the arteries as we have counted before; this is understood to mean cutting of the channel with a flame, which has been separated from it by what is dismembered and by the removal of the voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And leave the wound open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	So when the time comes for you to fear perforation, add two lips of tape to the edges of the wound, and stitch only the cartilage together.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	Then administer medicines that help flesh grow back until it is healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis says that the summary of this speech which we have already explained, is nothing other than for those abscesses which have already swallowed the patient's throat and the patient has returned to death (choked), and their wing is cut off, then some will make an incision in the epiglottis so that the patient may breathe through the wound by a certain breath and be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for this reason, I will command that the wound be left open until the poison of the disease is consumed; and its poison lasts three days; then I will command to close it up so that healing occurs.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore, I confessed that it had not cut any veins or arteries, and the wind was coming from the wound, so I treated it until it healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	It did not affect the servant's vocal cords, and after some days she recovered her voice.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that there is no fear in the section of the operation.

De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Regarding the operation on an abscess that occurs outside the neck region, which is called a neck hernia." 
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it is done in two ways, either naturally or accidentally.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	In the natural case, there is no need for treatment.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	The accidental situation is divided into two types: one similar to fat knots, and the other resembling an abscess caused by arterial blockage, which should be feared.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	One must not make presumptions with the patient unless they are very small in size.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	You should examine this and investigate it with your hands, and if you find something resembling fat knots that are not attached to any veins, then you must cut into them like nodules, removing what is contained within the skin and sac; otherwise, thoroughly inspect its entirety and treat the area accordingly until it heals.

De seccio de las specias de nodes.	On the classification of nodules." 
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	There are many types of swellings, and I have already mentioned all the species of them in the previous section.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	Now, let me explain how to distinguish between nodes and ulcers so there is no doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	So I say that an ulcer is characterized by heat, fever, and intense pain until the boiling of excess fluids subsides; it is complete when putrefaction sets in, at which point the fever, pain, and heat cease.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	A swelling is not characterized by heat, fever, or pain; consider the example of a lion's paw, which has its own sack.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	It is based on the color of the flesh, and its beginning is like a cyst, made in the same way as fat, whether large or small; they are of two types, either fatty and containing moisture, with many colors depending on the nature of the moisture, as I mentioned earlier.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	So now, when you arrive at the treatment of a swelling, express it and inquire about its beginning by using that instrument which is called a probe; it will guide you to its shape in this present chapter.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And then close your hand according to the size of the abscess, and extract the pus and see what has come out.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the running moisture is forgotten, regardless of its color, you then incise it with a superficial section as I have mentioned for other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if there is no moisture from the discharge but rather fat, you will know that it is fatty.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	Dry it with a section in the shape of a cross, following this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	As I have taught you, suspend it with a thread, and remove the skin from all sides easily, preserving the membrane or sac if possible, over that extract the healthy core with the knot.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it breaks during the operation and you cannot extract the healthy core entirely, note where it was broken and then extract it in pieces so that there remains no cause for further injury.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	For if any part of it is left behind, small or large, the knot may return as before.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is not large, then you stitch together its two lips and cure it with what incarnates.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	If the pulsating vein is on the opposite side, or if it is non-pulsating, then you apply and fill the place with three layers of gauze that are treated with vitriol and leave it tight for two or three days until the plague subsides and the boiling of the blood ceases; then return to cut away what remains of the tumor.

Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	On the treatment of male breasts, which are similar to female ones.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Sometimes the breasts of some men become swollen due to an excess of milk, which starts to flow during sleep. Then their breasts become swollen and resemble those of women; they look prominent and large.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	For those who suffer from this condition, it is necessary to make an incision in the form of a crescent moon according to this diagram: starting at point B and ending at point G; then remove all the flesh, fill the wound with red medicine (likely referring to some sort of ointment or poultice), join the two edges of the wound together with stitches, and wait for it to heal.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G.

De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These apostemata that appear beneath the armpit are a type of scrofula, hard and containing pus.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia. And when all the pus is evacuated, you fill it up with old cotton and leave them for another day.

De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On the sectioning of apostemata that occur due to arterial or venous issues." 
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text into English: 
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is from the veins surrounds the exterior of the heart.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	If you make an incision on this abscess, it is a mistake, especially if it is near the armpits, the ribs, the neck, and various other parts of the body; and it is quite large, so its cure with iron should be avoided, and that which is located in the extremities or head must also be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But for that which comes from the obstruction of the orifice of the bowels, make an incision in the line on the belly; then open up this incision with hooks and expose the bowels, releasing them from their coverings.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	Then place a needle on it and make it penetrate to the other side; tighten the bowels with a double thread in two places - which causes you to remove two bowels that are in the flanks.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	Then strike the place that is between two ligatures with a spatula until all blood within it comes out and the abscess dissolves.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then apply a cure that has been made with egg yolk so that the ligatures fall off; then heal it with appropriate ointments for this until it is cured.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you fear that you will extract the thread, then insert the needle under all the abscess until it comes out by the first incision, and stretch your threads into four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry the abscess in its middle part before it comes out of him, then you will cut off the excess of the thread, and leave what is tied on him.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then place on him a poultice that you have dipped in wine and oil, and then apply the cure which is made with herbs and ointments until it heals.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter 1 about abscesses that occur due to nerve torsion.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	How abscesses occur in the muscles and veins, and similarly how abscesses occur in the nerves when they are subject to pressure or occur due to excessive work, and likewise.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	It occurs mostly in the joints of the legs or ankle, or any place where the bones are badly joined.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a serious abscess, and is similar in colour to the rest of his body, and it is located on their head or neck; when it is deep with force, there is a similar sickness like numbness felt by the patient.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text into English: 
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, for those who suffer from joint pain, it is not advisable to be treated with iron [instruments], as this could quickly lead to contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	He who suffers from pain in the head or forehead should be treated with the spatula.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	If there is a small abscess, then take the scissors and cut it off from its base.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, suspend it with a thread, peel it off, and then remove it; fix the wound with stitches, and treat it until it is healed.

De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Regarding the section on abscesses that occur due to injuries in the abdomen.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	Some men have noticed spots on their bellies and other parts of the body, which are called fungi due to their similarity in appearance to mushrooms; these have a thin base and a thick head; often, their edges are turned outwards and they can be small or quite large.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have seen one case where there were two parts in his belly, which had very similar appearances and sizes; there was no difference between them, both being of a delicate texture.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And the lips of those parts were turned inward and cracked open, with moisture constantly flowing from it.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	So I dissected those parts and found that one was about 18 ounces in weight, while the other was approximately six ounces.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And during the operation and dissection of these parts, one must consider if the patient's body is moist, and if the appearance of their intestines is white, moist, and delicate in texture; then you should use a wide spatula to open it, and place your cautery over the fire. When you make an incision, many streams of blood will be expelled, so if there is any bleeding, you must cauterize that area.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	If you find the patient to be fearful and timid, avoid using any sharp instruments. Instead, take a freshly cast lead weight and attach it to their intestines in the manner described earlier. Leave it there for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	Then adjust and tighten the lead weight with a string or thread. Do not stop pulling on the heavy lead until it cuts into the part, causing it to separate and fall off by itself.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if there is a very large hernia, then its incision becomes a cause of concern and fear, especially when it is in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	It is possible that you cut open the patient's belly, then cauterize it to prevent its recurrence.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	Then cure him until the wound has healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And be careful not to presume to cut into something that is very dark in color, has little feeling, and looks unhealthy, as it could be cancerous.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	I shall come to remind you of this matter again soon.

De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	If it is due to humidity, then it is a lion and it is not hidden when you press it with your hand, nor is it constricted or swollen.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is due to blood, then these signs will appear: the abscess turns black and deteriorates.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	If it is due to flesh or meat, then it becomes a serious abscess, thick, hard, and embedded to a certain extent.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	If it is due to wind or gas, then its touch will feel like a lion.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation on it is to be considered as follows: if the prominence of the navel is due to arterial blood, venous blood, or wind (gas), then you are forbidden from treating it because there is fear and apprehension in such cases, as I have explained in the chapter where I discussed abscesses caused by arteries and veins.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	If the navel's prominence is due to intestines or hernia, then instruct the patient to lie with their back exposed and be extended; then mark a circle around the entire navel area using a thread; next, command them to bend towards you between your hands on their back; then encircle the marked navel location with a strip of leather that is wide enough; finally, cut open half of the abscess in its upper part with a big knife; and bind it around with strong thread or with cedar and the decent way to wrap.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have pulled back the covering (tela), then take that with a string; and cut off its excess.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	However, if it opposes your arrow or vein, then surround that knot and return to your operation; take two needles and put strong thread on them, and insert the two needles into the circle you have made around the abscess in a cross-like manner, making sure they penetrate; then tightly bind the abscess in four places over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, remove the needles and let the area be exposed so that the flesh can wither away on its own; or cut it when it becomes thin and will fall off easily, then treat it with a remedy for wounds until it is healed.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if there is a fleshy protrusion or moisture around the navel, then you should treat the abscess as we have mentioned, draining any blood or humidity from it; and afterwards, treat it with something that covers and consolidates the area.

De curacio de cranc.	On the treatment of wounds." 
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already mentioned, in the division of different types of pain and how they are treated with medicine, that it is best to avoid treating them with iron [instruments] so as not to cause ulcers; we have also spoken of pain caused by bile and the careful treatment required for it.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	The ancients said that there are certain cases where pain can be eradicated by removing the cause; this is true for pains in sensitive areas such as the breasts or groin and other similar parts of the body - it is best to remove [the affected part] entirely, especially if the problem is still small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when the pain is old and severe, do not undertake its treatment if you are unable to heal it or have never seen another case like it; do not attempt something that is beyond your abilities.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	The operation on the patient is done as described; you must first prepare and purge them with black bile in some cases, then bleed him if there are obvious signs of pleurisy.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	Then prepare the patient for surgery at the chosen location, and with good judgement, forbid any instruments that may harm him; then carefully make a concave incision all around [the affected area], ensuring that you do not sever its roots.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	Here is my line-by-line translation of the text you provided: 
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Here is the translation of the provided text:

De curacio de ydropici.	De curacio de ydropici.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text into English: 
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And the one who is cured with iron is only specific to althitas, and it is not close to being treated with iron for timpanists or yposarcha, as this is fatal.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	When you have treated this type of disease, a water-drinker with tympanic qualities, with medicines and your treatment does not work, then consider whether the patient has been weakened by another illness or is suffering from another form of dropsy, such as if they have a cough, abdominal pain, or similar symptoms. In that case, be cautious about treating them with iron, as it can be dangerous.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	However, if you observe the patient with excessive moisture and no other illness but dropsy alone, and they are neither an infant nor elderly, then the way to operate on them is as follows: lift the patient between your arms, have the minister press their hands against the patient's abdomen to squeeze out the water, directing it towards the region below the navel. Then, take a sharp-pointed spatula shaped like this:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	It should have two sharp, long sides with pointed ends like a spatula; however, it can be slightly shorter to avoid going too deep during the operation and puncturing the intestines.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	Here is the translation of the provided text:

Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	Mays evacua de aquella segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.

Then extract the instrument and retain the water which is caused because it is just retained by the string that retains the tube that goes into the bladder, for you to perforate this according to that manner.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	Then reinsert the instrument on another day if you see that the patient can bear it, extract a small quantity of water and do this for some days with caution, taking care not to leave any excess water.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	However, if you fear that the patient's condition is grave and you extract a large quantity of water, then cure them by burying in warm sand, sprinkling on sweet-smelling powder and exposing to sunlight for long periods; and treat with drying medicines until they are healed.

De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	On the cure of children born with their urine passages unpierced.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Some infants are born from their mother's womb, and the hole of their private part is not pierced (or a narrow tube or it is not in its place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Therefore, it is necessary to make an incision in him as soon as he is born with a very sharp knife according to this form:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	Then place in the wound a thin lead peg and bind it there; let it remain for three days or four.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when he wants to urinate, let him be seated, and let him urinate, then return the peg.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not place the lead (plug), it is likely that the urine which goes over this area will open up the wound.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	Moreover, anyone who has such a narrow opening should be treated with a lead (plug) as we have said for many days so that it can widen.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	Moreover, those in whom the opening is not located where it should be (i.e., born with the urethral opening on the underside of the penis) are called epispasis; this occurs when one is born with the tip of the penis missing so that he cannot urinate while standing, for when he tries to stand his penis bends upwards in his hand and thus it is not generation because the semen cannot reach the womb according to nature's rule, and it is a very serious illness.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.
