E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And sometimes it is administered to him with aristology longua and roots of celestial lily (which is celestial lily) and powder of orris and centaurea, and use these simple or adjusted remedies, triturate them and sift through a sieve, then powder over the honey which has been recounted; and make use of it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	If the sinus is prolonged and does not heal with this treatment, then know that the corruption has reached the bone, and it has already affected the bones or other hard tissues or ligaments; in such a case, you treat him with fistula-like cure, as mentioned above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	On the treatment of panaricium (felon) and torn fingernail, as well as on incising an added finger and its excision.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Panaricium (felon) is an abscess that forms under the toenail or fingernail, and sometimes it can occur on other fingers as well. If left untreated, it can progress and become an abscess with a fistula, turn into corruption, and spread its brac (corrosive matter) to corrode the root of the nail; this may lead to complete loss of the nail's integrity, or even reach the bone causing putrefaction, foul odour, dark color, and deformation of the fingertip.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	Here is my translation of the text:
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if corruption has already spread into the bone, then you must insert a knife into the bone and remove it, for there is no hope of healing when the bone is corrupt.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you see the corruption and the spread of disease in the finger, then you must cut it off at one of the joints according to its memory, and then cure it until it is healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if the nail is bruised or crushed and there is severe pain in it, then you must first bleed the patient, and then cut off the nail with a sharp spoon by making a transverse section from top to bottom, and be careful not to penetrate into the flesh beneath the nail, for you will cause them great pain, and this could lead to the formation of excessive scar tissue in that area; then treat that area with something that causes pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	This deformed finger, which is born in the hands of some men, is almost entirely made of flesh, and has very few bones or nails.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them are born at the base of the joint, or their origin is in one of the finger joints.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	But he who is born in some parts of the body will not be hurt by this, and as for him who was born in the joints, very lightly shall he be harmed.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And for those who are born with fleshy bodies, the incision is shallow; you should make this kind of cut with a broad knife.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	But for him who is born at the root of a joint, healing is difficult; so beware of cutting into him.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But in the case of someone who is born at the base of their fingers, you must make an initial circular cut into their flesh with a knife; then saw it closed with one of those saws appropriate for this task, and then heal him so that he may be made whole.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	But if the fusion occurs in fingers between their segments either by congenital deformity or through consolidation of injury or from cauterization with fire, or similar, then you must cut away that fused tissue so that those fingers may return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	Then place the affected area between some sheets soaked in rose oil so that they are not fused lightly, and separate them, or place a thin sheet of lead between these [fingers] until they are fused as is needed.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And in the same way, if there is consolidation at any point on the palm, you must dry up that consolidation as it was prepared and fits into the shape of the member.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Of incisions for maladies, there are varicose veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Maladies are varicose veins, and they are large twisted veins full of melancholic superfluities that appear in the limbs of the body, with their greatest occurrence being in the legs, especially in those who travel, work, or carry loads.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	In this case, you must administer a purge of the black bile from the heart several times with strong expulsion, and then bleed the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The cure for them with iron is according to two methods: one is that it be incised and that the black blood be drawn out, and the other method is that the vein be raised up and entirely extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The sectioning is done in this way: first immerse the leg in warm water until the thick blood from the leg is dissolved and made thin, then bind the patient's leg with a bandage from just above the hip to below the knee, and then cut the vein at one place or two or three places with wide incisions. Then draw up the black blood from below the leg up towards you, until such time as the quantity of blood that you want has been emitted and is sufficient for your purpose; this will take away the patient's strength.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then bind him up, and command him to refrain from foods that engender black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	Repeat the cure through bloodletting when the veins are full, and note this down for the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	However, their lifting is done in this manner: if the patient has hair on his legs, shave the leg and then place him in a bath; immerse the leg in cold water until it reddens and the veins become prominent; or, if no bath is available, have them exercise vigorously until the limb is fatigued.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	Then bind the base of the vein by cutting it either near its origin or at its rear end; you should cut it low down if it is deep.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	Then open the binding with hooks and strip the vein from all around until you feel it; you should look for its appearance where the rod is lowered towards darkness.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And so, when you release the binding, if you see it is white like a string.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	Then you place that rod underneath it until it is raised and freed of the binding, and suspend that with hanging hooks.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then cut another section close to that section with three cuts, and carefully remove the skin from the area above the vein so it becomes visible.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	Then lift that [part] and make an incision at the back section behind the ankle, carefully extract it and bring it out through the second section, and then remove it from the section above.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	Do this until you extract it from the section that is above all others or the highest section of all, once everything has been exposed; then make an incision there.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you fail to extract and lift it out, then insert a strong double-pointed needle with an eye [loop] at the end and use it to grab and pull it out, or insert a rod underneath and move your hand around until it is dislodged.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	Make sure it is not cut [during the procedure]; for if it breaks, it will be difficult for you to lift out that part and the patient may suffer harm from it.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Once all of that is dislodged, place over the affected area [a poultice] made with a soft cloth soaked in wine and rose oil mixed with regular oil, and treat it until it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	Certainly! Here is my translation of your provided text: 
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	The form of the wound by which the white matter is dried up:
Forma de unci orp:	Form of a poison drop:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not as thin as the drops and does not have a sharp tip so it doesn't pierce the vein; instead, it has flexible thickness, for if it were too thin, it would cut through the vein due to its thinness; there is excessive thickness in this, just like we mentioned.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Regarding the extraction of the leg vein:
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs, on low-lying lands just like in the Atage region of Arabia and in the low-lying lands of India that are dry, with little vegetation, and where there's no grass or trees.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is rarely generated in other parts of the body besides the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	Its gestation is from the putrefaction that comes below the skin, just like how venom produces snakes, worms, and scary creatures within the body.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	The sign of its appearance is when this vein occurs in the leg with severe inflammation, and then the area becomes blistered, and from that blistering starts to come out a vein that looks like the root of a plant.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as many times as his legs are moved by some cause outside of himself, wrap this in lead and place it under him.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if the condition is prolonged, then you make an incision in a part of him and wrap the remainder; do not make an incision where something has already come out from beneath it, for if you make an incision there, it will contract and go back into the flesh, causing abscesses and pus to form at the site as well as bad ulceration.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	Therefore, it should be treated with extra care and removed little by little until nothing is left of it behind him and there remains in the body no cause for its existence.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And this vein has come out in some men to be, in its length, of five or ten palms and it has already reached me that one came out at twenty palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is incised in the hour of its treatment, then insert a rod into its tract and pierce that with a long rod through to the body until everything which is within the matter has been evacuated, and apply putrefaction to the site for some days using medicines; then tend to this by means of the healing of abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes has many knots, especially when it appears at the ankle joint or in the foot, and produces many pores, and each pore emits a ray.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	So treat it as we have described in the division, and with what has been said above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Regarding the operation on worms generated under the skin, which is called bovine disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This disease is named in some lands as bovine illness because it has many knots that resemble worms and is actually a type of worm that is born between the tendons and flesh, moving up and down throughout the body, and is shown by the feeling of its movement from limb to limb until it breaks the tendon and comes out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	Its generation occurs due to the putrefaction of certain humours, just as worms, serpents, and lice appear in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	It is feared for its wickedness because when it moves to the brain and rises to the head, and reaches the eye, it opens a wound in itself and enters, destroying the eye which results in many knots.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	Here is my translation of the first source sentence: 
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	Here is the translation of the given sentence: 
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel: If you find that the pain has reached its peak near the heel, 
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	De sectione super aegritudinem nafir: 
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is called 'nafir' in our land, and it is a pain that appears in some body parts and then moves from one part to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And I have already seen this second case that I am telling you about.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to attend to a sick woman in a village, and upon examining her arm, I noticed a small inflammation on the vein of her forearm, which had been bruised for an hour. As I watched, I saw this inflammation gradually disappear as it turned white, but more lightly than if it were due to injury, almost like flowing silver moving from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	So the pain moved from that spot to her muscles, where it stayed for about an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	Then it went away on the other side of the body until it reached her other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And I noticed that it kept returning to her for the second time, moving all over her body as I had seen before; I was incredibly amazed by its transformation and the speed at which it moved from one part of her body to another.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	I had seen this before in my own patients in the same way, but I have encountered many instances where pain moves from one limb to another.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	I have never seen this with the same symptoms as in a woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I thought it could not be this but rather that is because the woman was old, with dry body and exposed veins, and in her case, the feeling of that windy sensation appears to have changed.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	It is necessary that this retrograde cure does not appear in those who are delicious and have a moist body with prominent veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And as you want to cure the patient and they feel that pain, then it is not the smell as we have described to you, so press on it and leave them lightly and gently until that windy sensation subsides, and cauterize the area.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you do not see it with your own smell, then cure it by evacuating the body and that which expels windy substances, and treat those with foul-smelling pills and pills made of serpent and similar.
De extraccio de sagetas.	On the extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are diversified according to the species and the parts of the body where they fall, for their diversity is that some have large points, some small ones, some hollow ones, some blunted ones, there are those which are solid; and then there are those with three edges, others that have tongues, and still other ones made out of wood.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And so if these signs appear to you, then refrain from the cure and extraction of the arrowhead unless otherwise necessary.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	But the signs of an arrowhead in the heart are as follows: it is close to the left nipple, and you feel that it has struck a hard object, but not a visible one; and note that the movement of the arrowhead resembles the pulse, and blood flows out black, along with extreme coldness in the extremities, cold sweats, and fainting; thus, be aware that death descends swiftly upon them.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when the arrowhead has pierced the lung are an emission of frothy blood from the wound, and the veins near the neck become inflamed, the patient's complexion changes, they exhale a great spirit, and crave cold air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	If the arrowhead strikes the covering of the foot, and pain occurs near the small ribs, then do this: make a large opening with great care due to severe pain and sighing, but ensure all muscle members are well.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if the arrowhead strikes the stomach, then often some undigested food will appear in the wound.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will relate this to you based on what I have witnessed about the nature of these arrows, so that you may understand their significance in terms of mild treatment.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	Which is caused by an arrowhead becoming lodged in the lacrimal bone of a person's skull at the root of their nose; I have extracted such an arrowhead from another part of the body, leaving a graze on the patient's ear, and they recovered without any harm coming to their eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And I extracted another arrowhead from a Jew, which had pierced him in the margin of his eye, below the eyelid, and the arrowhead was concealed; only a small portion of it could be grasped with the end attached to its shaft; it was a large Turkish arrowhead with a lion's head but without ears.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	The Jew has recovered, and there was no unfortunate damage to his eye.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And I extracted another arrowhead from a Christian man which had lodged in his throat, and it was an Arabic arrowhead with ears (barbs). Then I made an incision above that spot between two muscles, as the arrowhead had become embedded in the throat; then I skillfully maneuvered it, and subsequently extracted it. The Christian recovered.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called upon to cure him just as the arrow had pierced him three days ago.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	So I retraced the arrow's path with my very narrow probe; then I inquired delicately about it and did not feel anything; but he felt a sting beneath his right ear, so then I suspected that this was caused by the tip of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	I dressed the wound with an ointment that has attractive and digestive virtues, trusting that this place will become inflamed so that it shows me the location of the arrow, which I can then remove.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And I did not notice any significant incidents at the place where the arrow had reached; and I continued to apply ointment on him for many days without incident; meanwhile, the wound healed, but he was suffering from his injury during this time span of several days until one day when suddenly I felt the arrow inside his nose and reported this to him.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	So I placed an acute corrosive medicine on the wound for many days until it opened up; then with a probe I searched there and found the tip of the arrow, which was attached to the shaft.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	Here is the translated text: 
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some doctors judged that the cartilage of the nose was not restored, but I restored it and the wound was consolidated, and the patient is entirely healthy, and there is nothing wrong with him in any way.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	I remind you of the process of extracting certain arrows, and I advise you to establish rules and guidelines for what I have not mentioned, as the various aspects of this art and their definitions are not fully understood by narration alone; the book does not encompass all knowledge.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	Wise artisans make comparisons sparingly about matters; they consider what is presented as opposed to what is absent; and they must conduct new operations with novel instruments, deducing the foreign causes of the art when an accident occurs.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And so I say that arrows are not randomly removed from body parts, but according to two methods: either through the attraction of the surrounding area where they entered; or by employing the opposite approach in another part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	The one that is removed through the area it entered, or an arrow in fleshy tissue, must be extracted by drawing it out.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if you do not obey this instruction regarding the time of extraction, then it is advisable to leave it for a few days until the flesh surrounding it dries out and the attraction [of the arrow] lessens, thereby easing its removal.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And if it is embedded in the bone and does not obey your treatment, then leave it alone for a few days; repeat the procedure with traction and movement every day until it becomes dislodged.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if it does not obey your treatment after a few days, then you must bore into the path of the arrow in that bone from which it is protruding with a fine drill until the area is enlarged enough to remove the arrow, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrow is lodged in the bone of the head and has penetrated into one of the chambers of the brain, and the patient experiences any of the aforementioned accidents I mentioned, then refrain from extracting the arrow and leave it be for several days; for if the arrow pierces the membrane, death will not be prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is not lodged deeply in the bone but only pierces the heart, and it does not pass through to the membrane, and the patient survives for several days without experiencing any of those mentioned accidents, then devise a plan for extracting both the arrow and the patient.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	However, if it is deeply embedded and does not yield to extraction, then apply fine drills along the path of the arrow as we have described earlier, and treat the area until it is healed.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	Here is my attempt at translating the provided text: 
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot treat him due to the constriction of the wound and the length of the arrowhead, and there are no bones or nerves present in this case, then proceed by enlarging the wound so that it is feasible to extract the arrow.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if you have the patient's ears which are attached to them, then free the flesh in which it is embedded by separating each part with all your might; and devise a way to do this, for if you cannot achieve the escape of the flesh from the fracture of the ears nor its torsion, then heed these words.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	When you perform the extraction of the arrowhead in any location it may be, employ a twisting motion with your hand and forceps on all sides to ensure its compliance; do so with utmost delicacy lest the arrow breaks or proves difficult for you to draw from him.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you are unable to achieve this at the present time, then leave it be for several days until such a time that the surrounding parts have had some rest; and repeat these actions when it is alleviated.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	Should you encounter an instance of bleeding as a result of your actions, then treat it with the methods we have outlined in this chapter regarding wound care.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	Here is my attempt at translating the provided text:
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And therefore make the patient's body contract in such a way that they conform to the shape indicated by an arrow on their chest, because this is more beneficial.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	If you cannot achieve this perfectly, then do what is within your abilities to approximate the desired position using these shapes as a guide.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	But if the arrows are pointing away from each other due to some separation in the limbs or an injury that causes swelling around the joint above the fracture and sometimes makes it protrude beyond the skin; then you must reduce this, and let the section be according to the amount grasped by the forceps; then draw them out, for they have been made light so as to ease extraction.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	If the arrowhead is stuck in bone, then you must twist the shaft until it reaches the arrowhead, and amplify this motion to force it out; then extract it.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	Otherwise, leave it for a few days, and repeat the procedure until its removal.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the shaft of the arrow is protruding from it, then push it in further.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	But if the arrow is concave, then you push that with a strong instrument entering it because the arrow is relieved by that.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is poisoned, then you must hollow out all the flesh around it, as much as you can, and then treat it with whatever remedy seems appropriate.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrow strikes the foot, or the stomach, or the bladder, or the side, and it is close enough for you to reach with a finger, then you can try to grasp it with pincers. Extract it carefully, avoiding any veins or nerves, and then stitch up the wound as needed, treating it until it heals.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Method of extracting arrows with pincers:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	The ends of the pincers are like a bird's beak, made with a serrated edge so that when they grasp the arrow, they do not let go.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	There are many different types of pincers, large and small, with various designs, depending on the size of the arrow, the severity of the wound, and the accessibility to it.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquella sorda:
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Method of moving the paralyzed end:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	And in this way, the instrument is inserted into the concave cavity of the patient to alleviate their suffering.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	On bloodletting from veins:
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins usually used for bloodletting are as follows: three from the head, described in chapter 16, two pulsatile veins located near the ears called 'alhasisain'; two herbs found on the temples; and two veins that run along the tears of two eyes, known as 'aspicientz'. There is also one vein prepared at the middle point of the forehead and another at the tip of the nose. Additionally, there are two points on the neck and two veins located above and below the lips. Finally, there are two more veins underneath the tongue; these last ones are called 'angelic' veins.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	Moreover, the veins that are bloodlet in the arms total five: one is the cephalic vein, also known as 'the wild arm', which the common people call 'the head vein'; another is a paralyzed vein, commonly referred to as 'the sleep vein'. This is joined by the median cubital vein, or what the locals call 'the body's vein', while others name it after its function: 'digestion vein' . It derives from one branch of the basilic and another from the cephalic. The latter is also known as "the arm's vein" in common parlance, whereas the former is referred to by some as 'abdominal vein'. There is also a vein called 'funis brachii', found over the elbow, which is frequently used for bloodletting due to its visible appearance on the pit; and finally, there is the 'salvatella' vein located between the thumb's tip and the smallest finger, presenting two branches.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	Here is my line-by-line translation of the text: 
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The treatment of veins near the ears is suitable for ancient catarrhs, emigrants, and various ailments like headaches and ulcers.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	The method of bloodletting from those veins is as follows: first, shave the patient's head and vigorously rub their head at the occiput where the two veins are located; then have the patient tightly bind their neck with a cloth around both ears and the two venous areas; press on one of them with your finger, and if you feel a pulse in that spot, proceed.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Take the lancet, which is sharp, and introduce it below the vein in the elbow crease so that the fleam can be applied to the bone.

E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then bind it with ointment and leave it until it is healed.

Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre. And it is necessary for the phlebotomist, when performing this phlebotomy, to be very careful and cautious, as underneath there is an artery; if he errs and punctures that artery with the phlebotomy tool, he will cut into it and cause a flow of blood, so one must not perform this phlebotomy with a sharp tool but rather by cutting with scissors.

And now we caution the blood-letting practitioner to be aware of a certain vein that lies above it; for if during the phlebotomy they wound this nerve, then stupor will occur, and healing is difficult, and often one may not recover entirely. And sometimes this nerve becomes sensitive to touch; and at other times it remains hidden in some people, being subtle and unseen - hence you should place your blood-letting tool so that the cut avoids the nerve with all of your strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is located between two nerves, then you should cut the vein lengthwise.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The benefit of drawing blood from the cephalic vein is that it removes excess blood from the head and provides relief to those suffering from head ailments.

Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first point is to understand that phlebotomy is not administered unless for the preservation of health and as a precaution against future illnesses, and that it should be performed on one of the veins located in the arm: the cephalic, the basilic, or the median cubital vein; and that it should be done at the beginning of spring, before breakfast during spring and autumn, and in winter shortly after eating, when signs of repletion appear.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And the phlebotomy should be performed on the third day, or as soon as three hours have passed from the beginning of the day.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	But when phlebotomy is administered, it should be done when it is necessary and appropriate, whether at night or during the day, at any hour and in all times.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	And it is important that an infant should not undergo phlebotomy until they are fourteen years old, and a pregnant woman should only be bled from the fourth month up to the seventh month, while those who are elderly and have already passed sixty years of age should not be subjected to bloodletting.

E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	Then enter the bath if nothing prohibits it or practice some exercise to make sure that the blood is thinned.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	Apply the bloodletting on his foot at midday, around the third hour, as we have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor. Then pull out his arm and rub it a few times with your hand, bloodletter. After that, tie the ligature tightly using a strap and wrap it around twice.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	Here is my translation of the provided text:

And then the surgeon must perform a phlebotomy, making sure to press on his hands together between them until the veins are swollen and easily palpable.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And the phlebotomist must lubricate their phlebotomy tool with a bit of old oil, and then place two fingers from their left hand on top of that vein, under where they wish to perform the phlebotomy, so that the vein becomes slightly engorged, and percussion is quietened since among the veins it is this one which beats like a cord when you strike it in such a way that you must perform the phlebotomy; and it will be from those which are full of air and when you place your phlebotomist tool on top it contracts as if to close itself, and is revealed by the phlebotomist: and the phlebotomy tool does not open the vein, but instead it is closed - this one is tight.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	And so the phlebotomist must be careful and attentive to all these details.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And then after the phlebotomy tool is removed, if the vein appears open in one spot, then it is; and if not, you must repeat this action elsewhere nearby, or above it with haste, unless of course that area has an abscess.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	It seems you've provided a translation of the text into English already! May I assist with anything else?
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And it is better to use this oil over the other oils in this place." 
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	Here is my translation of the first sentence:
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	Here is my best attempt at translating the text: 
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And now he should draw some blood from that vein by opening it fully or another one.
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	And if some blackness or greenness remains in the area for a few days, do not note it; and if you wish, apply to that place some aloe and myrrh solution, or some juice of mallow or calamint or something similar.
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	In many cases, when this happens abscesses and swellings appear you must do a bloodletting in the arm.
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	So place your hand on it, and if you then find softness there must be more pressure on it, as that swelling is bad and evil; and so be aware of applying any of the things mentioned earlier because blood will flow strongly from the artery.
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Make a plaster with something that has astringent properties so the area hardens and then treat it with other cures until it is healed.
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	And you must draw blood from anyone according to the amount of virtue they have and according to the colour that appears on the blood as it flows.
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	For if the blood is black, then let it flow until it becomes red; and similarly, if you see that it's thick, let it flow until it becomes thin; and likewise, if it is sharp or pointed, let it remain so.
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.	And for someone who is full and strong, but requires bloodletting only once, the phlebotomy of the vein should be made broader, and the one performing it [phlebotomist] should stand upright.
E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	And for someone who is frail, do the opposite of what was mentioned before, and ensure that they are bled in small amounts over multiple sessions, and let their wound be narrow.
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	The best way to administer phlebotomy of the vein is through a transverse incision rather than puncture.
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	This method of phlebotomy is safer from excessive bleeding and the incision of nerves, and it is more commendable and safer than phlebotomy according to latitude and longitude.
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	And for someone who is prone to fainting, you should perform phlebotomy on them after giving them a small piece of bread soaked in either a wine infused with poppy seeds or plain oxymel lightly poured over it; and extract some blood from them in three or four separate sessions.
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	And if the complexion is cold, then take some bread soaked in either Myrrh syrup or spiced honey syrup with pepper, cinnamon, ginger, and similar spices; or aromatic and strongly scented syrup beforehand.
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	Certainly! Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And make use of other causes that we have mentioned in the division during the chapter on syncope due to evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And for one who wishes to heal his arm and dissolve his blood once again, it is necessary that you apply the flebotomy which was previously performed on him by evacuation, and the virtue of this is cold, so that he evacuates the blood little by little, but only according to the quantity of virtue in continuous days.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	But for those who wish to heal their arm and purify their blood a second time, and whose body is strong, then let this be done seven or nine hours after the first phlebotomy.
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	But for one who wishes to draw out the blood from their body in the opposite direction of its course (i.e., upwards), it is necessary that they be healed on the second day or the third.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	But if a body in which there is much blood has already been weakened and aggravated by causing an accidental fever, it is necessary that the blood be drawn from them once, and that a great quantity of their blood be taken out; and further, let all perception be heightened until syncope occurs. For you will have preserved all the conditions for phlebotomy, including placing your hand over the pulse to prevent the escape of the blood before it is taken, so that he does not become dead from syncope in place of becoming merely insensible; as many times has this happened when the phlebotomist was ignorant and negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	And it is not necessary when you want to release the arm and evacuate the blood for a second time, even if the vein's opening has already been closed and it has become difficult for the blood to flow out, that you press on him with vehemence and bend his arm slightly outward because this is very harmful.
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	Leave him be for now to allow the bloodletting to take effect; if there is any clotting of blood at the opening of the vein due to the fleam's sharpness; place on it some theriac or aloes, and apply a light compression until the blood has stopped flowing.
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is infected with an abscess, leave it be and do not touch it until the abscess has subsided.
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	And if it is necessary to evacuate blood for a second time and there is no excuse not to do so, then bleed him again at the same spot or on the other arm in another vein.
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	And when the vein called "Funis of the arm", which is composed of both the cephalic and basilic veins, has been bloodlet from either one but not the other, then bleed it again in the place of the absent or obscured vein.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	And the quality of phlebotomy is that the patient inserts their hand in warm water until the cup becomes reddish and a vein appears visibly.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	Then it should be tightly bound over that point with a mild and gentle bandage; then phlebotomy is done by small transversal incisions, not longitudinally or along the length of the vein.
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And if the incision is broad, let your phlebotomy be that which you do to him over the wrist joint with a small amount of bloodletting.
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	And if the flow of blood is blocked, then you should repeat placing your hand in warm water and allow the blood to run into the water until you achieve your required amount.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	However, if you were in the days of summer, then you would be exempt from repeatedly placing your hand in warm water; instead, a cold compress is placed on the patient's chest during winter time to stop bleeding.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the phlebotomy of this vein is more safe than all other veins because it does not have any pulsating vein or nerve underneath it.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the phlebotomy of the cubital vein on the right arm is appropriate for diseases related to the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	Under which conditions venesection is performed on the patient you need to hold his hand with a cloth, as it has been soaked in warm water, while inflating and exposing the vein properly; then cut the transversal part of said vein; however be warned that if you insert anything into it this will not benefit him.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	Make sure you do not cut your hand with the venesection, as their nerves are left bare of flesh.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	Then return your hand to the warm water and let the blood flow into it; for if you do not submerge it in warm water, the blood will clot at the opening of the vein and be prohibited from flowing out.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	And when the blood is extracted in the necessary quantity, you place on top of the vein an ointment made with oil and salt, so it does not coagulate; similarly be aware that this should also be applied to any small branch nearby.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	The benefit of the venesection on their left hand is that it corresponds to illnesses of the spleen.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	Do likewise in their venesection as you did on the other one.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	Here is the translation of the first source sentence: 
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And so, with a wide branch of a tree or leave their leg above the ankle should be cut, for it is better and more healthy.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you perform a phlebotomy on the face of the foot, then be cautious of the nerves that lie underneath, and make your phlebotomy across it as if you were to incise it.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And once the phlebotomy is completed.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	However, the elevation of blood is prohibited; then you must immerse the foot in warm water and allow the blood to flow into that until it is evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the phlebotomist misses on the first attempt, then repeat the phlebotomy in the same place but slightly deeper, for it is healthy; and do not fear harming him, but rather be cautious of the nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	Similarly, do the same for the other foot likewise.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And for the sciatic vein, the place as we have said is above the ankle of the wild side.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the benefit of bloodletting for him is relief from hip pain when it is caused by excessive blood.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	The method of bloodletting is to have the patient enter a warm bath and quickly tie their upper thigh on the affected side tightly with a strip of cloth that is placed behind the knee and over four fingers above the ankle joint.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And when it appears, then you will perform the bloodletting according to whichever method is most convenient and appropriate for you, and it is better done transversely; whether by incision or sectioning, as the area is safe.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	This condition is often found in elderly men and can be difficult to locate; if you cannot find it by touch or feeling, then bleed one of his branches instead which appear on the back of the foot between the little toe and the ring finger.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	Be mindful of the nerves, and let as much blood flow as you wish.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	Then release the tight binding and place a compress on the bloodletting site, securing it firmly but gently as it heals quickly.
